User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:68.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/68.0

Steps to reproduce:

- Install/upgrade to Firefox 68 on Windows Server 2008 R2 with Citrix XenApp 6.5.
- launch Firefox via Citrix Receiver or Citrix Receiver in a browser page.

When launching Firefox 68 64bit (both normal and ESR versions) via Citrix Receiver in a XenApp 6.5 on Windows 2008 R2 environment an Illegal Instruction Exception is produced (see attached image). After clicking 'OK' to close the application, the application window remains open and Firefox is responsive to some commands (opening/closing tabs, options, Content Blocking, etc.) although not reliably. No Web pages can be displayed.

- Hotfix Rollup Pack 7 for Citrix XenApp 6.5 for Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 is installed.
- Problem occurs with both Citrix Receiver 4.4 and 4.9.

- Firefox 67 64bit functions correctly but if it is allowed to update to version 68 then the error is produced as soon as it relaunches.
- A clean install of version 68 produces the error.
- 32 bit versions of Firefox 68 function correctly without error.
- Disabling all Citrix API hooks for the firefox.exe executable via the registry resolves the problem.
- Disabling only the Citrix 'Special Folder Redirection' hook (sfrHook) via the registry resolves the problem.
- Disabling the Special Folder Redirection Citrix policy in the Citrix AppCenter GUI does not appear to resolve the problem (I'm not 100% certain on this point).

- When when attempting to display a Web page in a new tab the 'loading' animation to the left of the tab's name appears but the page never loads.

- Exactly the same behaviour described above is seen when connecting to the Citrix server via RDP.



Expected results:

- Firefox 68 should function as Firefox 67 did.
